fields.headline: Uluru park reopens
fields.bodyText: Tours to Uluru Kata Tjuta national park in Australia's Northern Territory were returning to normal this week after several days of devastating bushfires, which destroyed a luxury camp and threatened a nearby resort. The fires, fanned by strong winds, gutted 12 of the 15 luxury tents at Longitude 131, the award-winning safari camp which opened in June last year, and later forced the temporary evacuation of Ayers Rock Resort, which was undamaged. The national park was closed for a day but reopened as the flames were extinguished after temperatures dropped. Voyages Hotels & Resorts plans to rebuild Longitude 131 by next March.
